channel.title: Too Much D on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Too Much D on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Is 50 ng of vitamin D too high, just right, or not enough
item.description:
• Overview of the controversy
      • Vitamin D needed to TREAT Health problems (30 ng to 150 ng)
      • May 2023 study 30-60 ng
      • U Shaped curve due to long follow-up time, not latitude - by Dr. Grant
      • Chart of Vitamin D levels vs race - April 2013
      • See also Google Scholar
      • See also web - vitamin D test “reference range” = 20-100 ng
      • Grassroots Health infographic 40-60 ng (2020)

Overview of the controversy

  • A few governments say 10 ng is OK

item.title: Frailty and vitamin D â€“ U shaped curve
item.description:
Circulating 25-Hydroxyvitamin D Levels and Frailty Status in Older Women.

J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2010 Dec;95(12):5266-5273.

Ensrud KE, Ewing SK, Fredman L, Hochberg MC, Cauley JA, Hillier TA, Cummings SR, Yaffe K, Cawthon PM; for the Study of Osteoporotic Fractures Research Group.

M.P.H., One Veterans Drive (111-0), Minneapolis, Minnesota 55417. ensru001@umn.edu.

Context: Vitamin D deficiency and frailty are common with aging, but the association between these conditions is uncertain. Objective: To determine the association between 25-hydroxyvitamin D (25(OH)D) levels and prevalent and incident frailty status among older women.
